topics.title: Introduction and Background
topics.summary: Lenny introduces Sanchan Saxena’s career (Microsoft, Yahoo, Instagram, Airbnb, Coinbase) and previews topics like leadership lessons, COVID at Airbnb, hiring PMs, and experimentation.

topics.title: Sponsor Break
topics.summary: Sponsor messages for Dovetail (user research/insights) and Persona (identity/KYC/AML).

topics.title: Sanchan’s path into product management
topics.summary: Sanchan shares his early entrepreneurial attempt, move to Microsoft (Hotmail), and progression through Instagram, Airbnb, and ultimately Coinbase, including his growing conviction in Web3.

topics.title: Career advice: little bets and learning fast
topics.summary: He advises against rigid career planning, advocating “little bets,” rapid recovery, and balancing the art and science of product management by choosing roles that maximize learning velocity.

topics.title: Choosing startups vs big companies to learn
topics.summary: Sanchan explains different learning modes (starter, 0→1, scaler) and how to pick environments that match your strengths—startups for getting started, big tech for scaling systems and innovation.

topics.title: Why Airbnb was his biggest learning experience
topics.summary: He describes Airbnb as a compressed masterclass: building real-world products (not just software), learning product craft from Chesky, scaling the PM org, and leading through crisis.

topics.title: Inside Airbnb’s COVID crisis and turnaround
topics.summary: Sanchan recounts the sudden collapse in travel, layoffs and debt raise, shifting to two-week planning, dissolving team boundaries, and repositioning Airbnb vs hotels around safety and privacy.

topics.title: Two-week planning mechanics and morale building
topics.summary: He details how top-down priorities and bottom-up signals drove biweekly execution, how leaders communicated uncertainty honestly, and how belief- and founder-led storytelling sustained morale amid poaching.

topics.title: Sponsor Break
topics.summary: Sponsor message for Productboard (product discovery, prioritization, and roadmapping).

topics.title: Founder lessons: simplicity, intentionality, and Stories
topics.summary: Sanchan contrasts Instagram and Facebook approaches to Stories, highlighting Kevin Systrom’s simplicity and conviction, and the importance of intentional product direction over over-reliance on A/B testing.

topics.title: Airbnb product philosophy: 15/10 vision then scale
topics.summary: He explains Chesky’s method: design an unconstrained ideal end-state (15/10), build a non-scalable but lovable version in one place, then learn what works and scale selectively.

topics.title: When to trust gut vs data and A/B tests
topics.summary: Sanchan frames intentionality as choosing the destination (like GPS), treats intuition as “data not yet significant,” emphasizes persistence plus iteration, and shares an Instagram Stories example where vision overruled research.
